intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium glaucopsis subsp. leucophaeum, commonly known as the white-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine white pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by pale yellow to white ray florets, contributing to its ornamental value.
